intro: Ruellia solitaria, commonly known as the solitary ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia solitaria thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments.
